name: Aspirin
description: Aspirin is a medication used to treat type 2 diabetes by controlling blood sugar levels. It works by helping the body regulate the amount of sugar in the blood, which is essential for people with diabetes. Maintaining proper blood sugar levels can prevent complications such as nerve damage, kidney damage, blindness, and cardiovascular disease. Bisolvon is usually taken once or twice a day with meals, and it is important to follow the dosing instructions provided by your healthcare provider. Side effects may include hypoglycemia (low blood sugar), which can cause symptoms like shakiness, sweating, and dizziness. Regular monitoring of blood sugar levels is recommended while taking this medication. Bisolvon is often part of a comprehensive treatment plan that includes diet, exercise, and possibly other medications to effectively manage diabetes.Used to reduce pain, fever, or inflammation.
